intro: Pavonia typhalaeoides, commonly known as the redroot false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red, typically blooming in the spring and summer months. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges and often have a reddish tint on the underside. Pavonia typhalaeoides is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in partial to full sunlight.
